channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: Steel fell to 3,067 CNY/T on October 31, 2025, down 0.68%
item.description: Steel prices fell to 3,067 CNY per ton on October 31, 2025, down 0.68% from the previous day. Over the past month, steel prices have declined by 0.90% and are down 6.78% compared to the same time last year. Steel is expected to trade at 3,022.85 Yuan/MT by the end of this quarter and 2,890.00 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

item.title: HRC Steel price trends and forecasts
item.description: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel price decreased to 789 USD/T, the lowest since February 2025. Over the past month, HRC Steel prices rose 5.09% and are up 18.63% year-over-year. Analysts expect HRC Steel to trade at 827.34 USD/T by the end of this quarter and 892.84 USD/T in 12 months.

item.title: Ivanhoe Mines Issues 2025 Third-Quarter Financial Results Overview of Construction and Exploration Activities
item.description: Ivanhoe Mines reported Q3 2025 copper production of 71,226 tonnes, with year-to-date output at 316,393 tonnes, maintaining its annual guidance of 370,000–420,000 tonnes. Production was impacted by seismic activity and flooding at the Kakula Mine, but the Phase 3 concentrator operated above design capacity, and new power supply is expected from November 2025.

item.title: Ivanhoe Q3 Profits Shrink on Copper Mine Disruption
item.description: Ivanhoe Mines saw a significant drop in Q3 2025 profits due to seismic activity and flooding at its Kamoa-Kakula copper complex, resulting in lower copper production and sales. Despite the disruption, the company remains on track to meet its revised annual production guidance.

item.title: Critical Minerals Report (11.01.2025): Trump-Xi Rare Earth Deal Buys Time Not Security While Copper Soars to New Records
item.description: Copper equities led gains in the S&P Global Metals & Mining Index, driven by strong market sentiment and record copper prices. The report highlights ongoing global efforts to secure critical minerals supply chains amid geopolitical developments.

item.title: Critical Minerals Report (11.01.2025): Trump-Xi Rare Earth Deal Buys Time Not Security While Copper Soars to New Records
item.description: Nickel prices remained volatile around $16,500 per tonne amid concerns over supply chain consolidation, particularly with the European Commission investigating the sale of Anglo American's nickel assets to a Chinese state-backed company. The report highlights geopolitical tensions impacting nickel supply security, alongside a rally in copper prices driven by tightening inventories and infrastructure optimism.

item.title: Diamond Drilling Underway on Goodwin Copper-Nickel-Cobalt Project
item.description: Diamond drilling is in progress on the Goodwin copper-nickel-cobalt project in New Brunswick's Bathurst Mining Camp, indicating ongoing exploration and potential capacity expansion in nickel production. This project reflects continued investment in nickel resources amid evolving market dynamics.

item.title: Indonesia's nickel mining for EV boom threatens environment
item.description: Indonesia, the world’s top nickel producer, is expanding nickel mining to meet rising EV battery demand, but this growth threatens biodiversity and ecosystems. The country enforces domestic processing to maximize economic benefits, yet environmental activists warn of pollution and ecological harm from mining activities amid the EV boom.

item.title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
item.description: Italy's Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views the US government's planned 50% tariff on copper as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. Prysmian, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, is in regular contact with US officials and expects the tariff to apply to both raw metal and semi-finished products like cable.

item.title: Commonwealth Rolled Products, MetalX form partnership to advance sustainable aluminum production
item.description: Commonwealth Rolled Products and MetalX have announced a partnership aimed at advancing sustainable aluminum production. The collaboration focuses on developing more environmentally friendly aluminum manufacturing processes.

item.title: Copper Plunges More Than 4%
item.description: Copper futures dropped over 4% to below $4.9 per pound following President Trump's warning of a significant tariff increase on Chinese goods. Supply disruptions in Chile and Indonesia continue to tighten global copper availability, with Chile's Codelco reporting its lowest monthly output in over 20 years.

item.title: When going green becomes the new profit curve for aluminium. Or does it?
item.description: The aluminium industry faces a critical juncture with an expected 80% rise in demand by 2050, driven by the energy transition. To meet this demand sustainably, the sector must invest heavily in technologies like inert-anode smelting to eliminate direct emissions, requiring about USD 200 billion by 2050. This investment is essential to maintain competitiveness amid tightening regulations and market pressures.

item.title: Ferrous pricing remains on narrow path
item.description: U.S. steel production increased by 2.2% through September 2025 compared to 2024, with 66.7 million tons produced in the first nine months. Ferrous scrap prices remained stable in a narrow range, with some volatility in September negatively impacting scrap sellers. U.S. mills are expected to show stable to rising demand for recycled steel in 2025.

item.title: Cleveland-Cliffs and Posco sign partnership to mitigate steel import tariffs
item.description: Posco signed a strategic partnership with Cleveland-Cliffs, the second-largest U.S. steelmaker, to mitigate trade risks including the 50% U.S. steel import tariff. Posco is considering investing in Cleveland-Cliffs, potentially acquiring a 20% stake valued at approximately $1.2 billion. Cleveland-Cliffs specializes in high value-added flat steel products for the automotive industry.

item.title: Steel demand weak for three years
item.description: Crude steel production is forecast to fall by 11% year-on-year in 2025, following a 10% drop in 2024. Industry insiders indicate ongoing weakness in steel demand over the past three years, impacting production volumes.

item.title: U.S. Steel announces significant increases to Galvalume coating extras
item.description: U.S. Steel announced significant price increases for its Galvalume coating extras effective November 2, 2025, with hikes ranging up to 30%. This reflects rising costs and market demand for coated steel products.

item.title: Turkey's Raw Steel Production Sees New Surge: 1% Increase
item.description: Turkey's crude steel production increased by 1% in the January-September 2025 period, reaching 28.1 million tons, with a 7.2% rise in September alone. This growth reflects Turkey's strengthening position in the global steel market, supported by government incentives and efforts to reduce import dependency.

item.title: Cleveland-Cliffs and Posco sign partnership to mitigate steel import tariffs
item.description: Posco has signed a strategic partnership with Cleveland-Cliffs, the second-largest U.S. steelmaker, to mitigate the impact of U.S. steel import tariffs. Posco is considering investing in Cleveland-Cliffs, potentially acquiring a significant stake to navigate trade risks and strengthen their market position.

item.title: U.S. Steel announces significant increases to Galvalume coating extras
item.description: U.S. Steel announced price increases ranging from 30% to 49% for its Galvalume coating extras effective November 2, 2025, reflecting adjustments in response to market conditions.

item.title: ArcelorMittal gets environmental clearance for Anakapalli steel plant in Andhra Pradesh
item.description: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel's 8.2 MTPA greenfield integrated steel plant in Anakapalli district has received environmental clearance. The plant will use advanced, energy-efficient, and low-emission technologies meeting global sustainability standards, supporting India's position in sustainable steel production and catalyzing regional industrial growth.

item.title: Centre gives green clearance to planned AMNS steel plant at Nakkapalli
item.description: The Union Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change has recommended environmental clearance for the ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel plant at Nakkapalli, Andhra Pradesh. The plant, India's largest greenfield steel manufacturing initiative, will employ advanced, low-emission technologies and is expected to anchor the Andhra Pradesh Industrial Corridor.

item.title: Copper price rally could cool after surge to record high - MINING.COM
item.description: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange rose as much as 1.5% to $11,200 per metric ton, surpassing the previous record high set in May 2024. The rally was driven by concerns over mine supply shortages and optimism about a US-China trade deal, although analysts caution that without sustained demand growth, the rally may slow. Major producers like Glencore and Anglo American reported lower copper output in the first nine months of 2025, tightening supply.

item.title: Copper Prices Higher Ahead of Trump-Xi Meeting
item.description: Copper prices rose on optimism about a US-China trade deal, with benchmark copper on the LME up 0.6% at $11,026 per metric ton and US futures also up 0.6%. The rise was supported by data showing China's industrial profits grew at their fastest pace in nearly two years in September, although the Yangshan copper premium shrank, indicating slower purchase pace.

item.title: Copper Hits 12-week High - Trading Economics
item.description: Copper prices increased to $5.21 per pound, the highest level since July 2025, gaining 7.03% over the past four weeks and nearly 20% over the last 12 months. The rise reflects ongoing supply concerns and market tightness despite some demand weakness.

item.title: Copper hits 17-month peak on US-China trade deal optimism
item.description: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange reached a 17-month high, trading at around $11,011 per metric ton, driven by easing trade tensions between the US and China and expectations of stronger growth and demand. The optimism about the trade deal has spurred buying in the copper market.

item.title: Nickel price soars for 2 consecutive trading days
item.description: Nickel prices on the London Metal Exchange (LME) surged by US$145/ton to US$11,930/ton on November 2nd, marking a significant two-day rally. This sharp increase reflects heightened volatility and potential short-term bullish sentiment in the nickel market.

item.title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low
item.description: Nickel futures dropped below $15,100 per tonne, the lowest in over a month, as oversupply from Indonesia continues to pressure the market. LME inventories have reached 308,000 tons, the highest since 2020, driven by a surge in Indonesian production and increased Chinese refining.

item.title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low
item.description: Nickel futures dropped below $15,100 per tonne, the lowest in over a month, due to continued oversupply from Indonesia flooding global supply chains. LME inventories reached a record high of 308,000 tons, with a significant share originating from Indonesia and China. In response, Indonesia has tightened production quotas and shortened mining permit validity to better regulate output and stabilize prices.

item.title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers for Groundbreaking Clean Backup Energy Initiative in Data Centers
item.description: Phinergy's aluminum-air backup solution was selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers as a key technology to accelerate the transition to net-zero operations. This technology offers a clean, scalable alternative to diesel backup generators and will be scaled to MW level for deployment in live data center environments.

item.title: The 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit 2025 to Tackle Sustainability and Policy Challenges
item.description: The upcoming 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit, scheduled for November 11-12, 2025 in Düsseldorf, Germany, will gather industry leaders and policymakers to discuss decarbonisation challenges in the aluminium sector. Key topics include green aluminium production, recycling, circular economy, and EU regulations such as the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM).

item.title: Steel industry pushes for stronger safeguard duties to check cheap imports
item.description: Indian steelmakers are urging the government to impose stronger safeguard duties to combat rising steel imports, especially from China. Despite increased exports, India remains a net importer, with domestic stainless steel capacity utilization at only 60% due to cheap imports.

item.title: ArcelorMittal gets environmental clearance for Anakapalli steel plant in Andhra
item.description: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel (AM/NS) has received environmental clearance for its 8.2 million tonnes per annum greenfield integrated steel plant in Andhra Pradesh, India. The facility will use advanced, energy-efficient, and low-emission technologies meeting global sustainability standards, marking India's largest greenfield steel manufacturing initiative.

item.title: Tenaris to Commence a USD 600 million Second Tranche of its USD 1.2 Billion Share Buyback Program
item.description: Tenaris announced the launch of a $600 million second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, running from November 3, 2025, to April 30, 2026. The buyback will be executed by a bank under a non-discretionary agreement, with purchased shares to be cancelled.

item.title: LME WEEK: US aluminum price rise spurs deliveries from Canada
item.description: US aluminum prices have risen to around $2,750 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, with the Midwest premium reaching a record $0.77 per lb ($1,697 per ton) in early October 2025. This premium fully prices in the 50% US tariff on aluminum imports, leading to increased but not yet full-scale deliveries from Canada, which remains a major supplier.

item.title: The most-traded cast aluminium contract approaches the RMB 21,000 per tonne mark, maintaining a short-term rising trend
item.description: Cast aluminium alloy futures in China rose 0.77% to RMB 20,965 per tonne on November 3, 2025, supported by low scrap supply and stable demand for ADC12 alloy. The market shows a short-term upward trend amid these supply-demand dynamics.

item.title: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory in Two Regions Rises to 99,500 mt on Nov 3, 2025: SMM
item.description: Aluminum billet inventory in two major domestic regions in China has increased to 99,500 metric tons as of November 3, 2025, according to SMM data. The report also notes that a Shandong-based aluminum enterprise has announced a higher November 2025 prebaked anode tender benchmark price.

item.title: Steel Prices Fall in China, Down 6.78% Year-on-Year
item.description: Steel prices in China fell to 3,067 CNY/T on October 31, 2025, down 0.68% from the previous day and 6.78% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect prices to continue declining, with forecasts of 3,039.40 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and 2,904.76 in 12 months.

item.title: HRC Steel Prices Rise 5.58% Over Past Month, Up 19.19% Year-on-Year
item.description: HRC (hot-rolled coil) steel prices increased to 851 USD/T on October 31, 2025, up 0.12% from the previous day and 19.19% compared to last year. Prices are expected to rise further, with forecasts of 864.45 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 934.57 in 12 months.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Lifts Iron Ore Price Outlook Amid Resilient Chinese Production
item.description: Goldman Sachs has raised its 2026 iron ore price forecast to $93/tonne, citing macroeconomic support and steady Chinese steel production. However, the bank expects prices to drop to $88/tonne by late 2026 due to potential weakness in China's steel sector.

item.title: Iron ore slips on declining steel production, rising inventories in China
item.description: Iron ore futures prices have softened due to declining steel production and rising inventories in China. This reflects ongoing concerns about demand and overcapacity in the Chinese steel sector.

item.title: Iran's Arfa Iron and Steel Company's production increases
item.description: Iran's Arfa Iron and Steel Company reported a 5% increase in production during the first seven months of the current year. Further details are available to subscribers.

item.title: Copper declines for third day on concerns Over China's economy
item.description: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange fell 0.3% to $10,854 a ton amid concerns about China's slowing manufacturing activity and economic health. Despite a recent record high fueled by easing US-China trade tensions and supply disruptions, prices have pulled back as the market remains cautious about demand prospects.

item.title: Copper Prices in London Hit Record High on Supply Fears
item.description: LME three-month copper futures reached a record high of $11,173.50 a metric ton driven by supply concerns after disruptions at major mines and lowered production forecasts from producers like Glencore and Anglo American. The previous record was $11,104.50 set in May 2024.

item.title: Anglo–Teck alliance reshapes global copper outlook
item.description: The merger between Anglo American and Teck is set to create one of the most powerful forces in global copper supply, with combined production nearing one million tonnes annually and significant synergies expected from major South American assets. The merger is expected to deliver additional copper output and reshape global supply chains.

item.title: Ivanhoe Q3 profits shrink on copper mine disruption
item.description: Ivanhoe Mines reported a significant drop in Q3 profits due to disruptions at its Kamoa-Kakula copper complex in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, caused by seismic activity and flooding. Production and sales declined sharply, though the company remains on track to meet its revised annual guidance.

item.title: China's Strategic Control of Global Copper Refining Supply Chain
item.description: China continues to dominate global copper refining capacity, with plans to add 2.5 million tonnes of new capacity by 2028. Despite efforts to diversify refining capacity elsewhere, China's infrastructure advantages and expansion plans are expected to maintain its market leadership for the next decade.

item.title: Copper Miners Plunge Amid US-China Tensions
item.description: Shares in Australian copper mining companies fell sharply due to escalating US-China tensions, which have raised concerns about reduced global copper demand and potential supply chain disruptions. The market reaction reflects heightened uncertainty over trade relations and their impact on commodity prices.

item.title: Nickel prices were in the doldrums on November 3 with US Q3 economic growth expected to approach 4%
item.description: On November 3, the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 122,000 yuan/mt, a slight increase of 50 yuan/mt from the previous day. The nickel market showed subdued price movement amid broader economic expectations of US Q3 growth nearing 4%.

item.title: Nickel fell to 15,210.75 USD/T on November 3, 2025, down 0.26% from the previous day
item.description: Nickel prices declined slightly by 0.26% to 15,210.75 USD per tonne on November 3, continuing a downward trend over the past month with a 1.65% fall. The price is also down 5.64% compared to the same time last year, reflecting ongoing market pressures and expectations of further price decreases over the next year.

item.title: Nickel Mines Ltd. Reports Strong Q3 2025 Performance Amid Strategic Financial Moves
item.description: Nickel Mines Ltd. reported significant EBITDA growth in its RKEF and HPAL operations during Q3 2025 despite a temporary dip in sales from its Hengjaya Mine. The company issued US$800 million in senior unsecured notes to refinance debt, reducing costs and extending maturities, while also achieving safety milestones and advancing production quotas.

item.title: Terra Metals Multi-Metal Discovery at Southwest Prospects
item.description: Terra Metals Ltd revealed a multi-metal discovery with thick titanium-sulfide reefs containing elevated cobalt, copper, nickel, and PGM values. With 49 drill holes completed and 45 pending assays, the discovery shows significant expansion potential, positioning the company for growth amid rising cobalt prices and ongoing exploration.

item.title: PAM Mineral Nine-Month Profit Surges 131% on Higher Sales Volume
item.description: IDX-listed nickel mining company PT PAM Mineral Tbk reported a 131% profit increase over nine months driven by higher sales volume, reflecting strong operational performance in nickel production.

item.title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low on Oversupply from Indonesia
item.description: Nickel futures dropped below $15,100 per tonne, the lowest in over a month, due to oversupply from Indonesia's booming production. Indonesian nickel intermediates flooding global supply chains have pushed LME inventories to record highs, prompting regulatory tightening to stabilize output and prices.

item.title: Announcement on the Addition of the 'MHP Cobalt Payable to SMM Cobalt Metal (in-whs Rotterdam)' Price Point
item.description: SMM announced the publication of a new price point for MHP cobalt payable to SMM cobalt metal in Rotterdam starting November 5, 2025. This reflects market demand for greater price transparency and standardization amid supply shortages of cobalt intermediate products affecting nickel intermediate prices.

item.title: Nickel Mining 2025: Sustainable Growth In Asia
item.description: Asia's nickel mining industry is adopting advanced technologies such as automation, AI analytics, and water recycling to enhance sustainability. Indonesia and the Philippines lead in responsible sourcing and environmental practices to meet rising demand from EV and stainless steel markets.

item.title: Mustard plants: Nature's new miners for sustainable nickel extraction
item.description: Researchers are exploring the use of genetically studied mustard plants to extract nickel from soil sustainably. By delaying flowering and enhancing nickel uptake genes, this phytomining approach could offer an environmentally friendly alternative to traditional mining.

item.title: Tenaris Announces Second Tranche of USD 600 Million Share Buyback Program
item.description: Tenaris initiated the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, authorizing a financial institution to repurchase up to $600 million of shares starting November 3, 2025, through April 30, 2026. The repurchased shares will be canceled, potentially increasing earnings per share and reflecting confidence in the company's financial position.

item.title: Tenaris Launches $600M Second Tranche Under $1.2B Buyback
item.description: Tenaris announced the start of the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, with purchases beginning November 3, 2025, and ending by April 30, 2026. The buyback complies with EU market abuse regulations, and all repurchased shares will be canceled, supporting shareholder value.

item.title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
item.description: Prysmian has been awarded a tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and involves laying cables at depths up to 800 meters in the Strait of Sicily, enhancing energy security between Europe and Africa.

item.title: Aluminum Price Hits Three-Year High at $2,920/Tonne
item.description: Aluminum prices surged to $2,920 per tonne, the highest since May 2022, driven by China's state-imposed production caps that have tightened supply amid rising global demand. The price increase reflects sustained buying pressure and broader strength in other metals like zinc and lead.

item.title: Aluminum price hits three-year high as US-China truce buoys outlook
item.description: Aluminum futures on the London Metal Exchange rose to $2,902 per metric ton, marking a three-year high amid tightening supply in China and improved demand outlook following a US-China trade truce. Despite positive momentum, risks remain due to slowing manufacturing activity in China.

item.title: Aluminum prices soar to 17-month high on base metals rally, eased US-China trade tensions
item.description: Aluminum prices surged to their highest level since May 2022, rising 0.9% to $2,909.50 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, supported by a rally in base metals and eased US-China trade tensions.

item.title: Aluminum Price Hits Three-Year High at $2,920/Tonne
item.description: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high of $2,920 per tonne due to China's state-imposed production caps that have tightened global supply amid rising demand. The market is also affected by raw material quality issues, energy costs, and infrastructure bottlenecks, contributing to sustained buying pressure.

item.title: Alcoa (AA) Soars as Aluminum Prices Hit 17-Month High Amidst Green Energy Boom
item.description: Aluminum prices climbed above $2,900 per tonne driven by China's strict production caps and new environmental regulations targeting coal-powered plants. Supply disruptions from a major fire at Novelis' U.S. facility, geopolitical unrest in Guinea, and Alcoa's refinery closure in Australia further tightened supply, while easing US-China trade tensions boosted demand outlook.

item.title: Aluminum price hits three-year high as US-China truce buoys outlook
item.description: Aluminum prices reached their highest level since May 2022, supported by China's production caps and an improving demand outlook following a US-China trade truce. Despite some economic slowdown signals in China, the market remains tight with inventories at their lowest since 2021.

item.title: Nucor increases HR spot price by $5/ton
item.description: Nucor raised the hot-rolled (HR) steel spot price by $5 per ton amid ongoing market adjustments. Despite this increase, US steel product prices remain significantly lower than landed import prices, reflecting continued market pressure. The domestic scrap market is expected to form soon for November shipments, with neutral expectations for price changes.

item.title: HRC Steel Price Falls Slightly to $844.04/T on November 3, 2025
item.description: The price of hot-rolled coil (HRC) steel fell by 0.82% to $844.04 per ton on November 3, 2025. Despite the recent dip, HRC steel prices have risen over 5% in the past month and are up more than 20% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts suggest prices may rise to $864.45 by the end of the quarter and $934.57 within 12 months.

item.title: Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cut in December Decline, LME Copper Fluctuates and Closes Lower Last Friday
item.description: LME copper prices fluctuated, opening at $10,857.5/mt and closing slightly lower at $10,891.5/mt, down 0.35%. Shanghai copper contracts also declined marginally. Market sentiment shows copper prices retreating with procurement sentiment rising and spot premiums narrowing.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices were in the doldrums on November 3
item.description: Nickel prices on the SHFE moved sideways with slight gains amid positive China-US trade developments easing market concerns. LME nickel inventory increased to a nearly five-year high, suggesting continued market oversupply and sideways price movement expected in the near term.

item.title: Canada Nickel and the University of Texas at Austin Launch Carbon Sequestration Pilot at Crawford Nickel Project
item.description: Canada Nickel and the University of Texas at Austin have launched a one-month in-situ carbon sequestration pilot at the Crawford Nickel Project in Ontario. The pilot, supported by the U.S. DOE ARPA-E, tests rapid CO2 mineralization in ultramafic rock and aims to inform post-mining sequestration and the development of a Zero-Carbon Industrial Cluster.

item.title: Canada Nickel And The University Of Texas At Austin Launch Carbon Sequestration Pilot At Crawford Nickel Project
item.description: Canada Nickel Company Inc. is collaborating with the University of Texas at Austin on a carbon sequestration pilot at its Crawford Nickel Project. The initiative, backed by the U.S. DOE ARPA-E, explores innovative methods to store CO2 and reduce costs in nickel processing, supporting sustainable mining practices.

item.title: Canada Nickel and the University of Texas at Austin Launch Carbon Sequestration Pilot at Crawford Nickel Project
item.description: Canada Nickel and the University of Texas at Austin have initiated a one-month pilot for in-situ carbon injection at the Crawford Nickel Project. The pilot is independent of Canada Nickel’s other carbonation initiatives and supports the vision for a Zero-Carbon Industrial Cluster in Northeastern Ontario.

item.title: Costs down and prices up, the aluminium industry's average profit broke through RMB 5,000 per tonne in October
item.description: The aluminum industry saw average profits exceed RMB 5,000 per tonne in October due to stable electricity prices and declining alumina costs, despite expected increases in power costs in November. Overall, aluminum production costs are forecast to slightly decrease in November, supporting profitability.

item.title: Costs down and prices up, the aluminium industry's average profit broke through RMB 5,000 per tonne in October
item.description: The aluminum industry saw average profits exceed RMB 5,000 per tonne in October 2025 due to stable electricity prices and declining alumina costs. However, power costs are expected to rise in November with increasing coal prices and seasonal factors, while overall aluminum production costs may slightly decrease.

item.title: JSW Steel Ltd Stock Update: Slight Decline on November 4, 2025
item.description: JSW Steel Ltd's stock price experienced a minor drop of 0.07%, trading at ₹1,191.90 per share. This slight decline has sparked discussions among investors about the company's short-term performance amid current market conditions.

item.title: Tata Steel Ltd Stock Remains Unchanged on November 4, 2025
item.description: Tata Steel Ltd's share price remained stable at ₹182.10 with no change reported. This stability may influence investor sentiment as the steel market navigates ongoing economic factors.

item.title: China's Strategic Steel Revival Without Mandating Supply Cuts
item.description: China is reviving its steel industry by focusing on market-driven production adjustments rather than government-mandated supply cuts. Mills are adjusting output based on demand and margins, with annual production likely to fall below 1 billion tons for the first time in six years due to weak domestic demand and strong export opportunities.

item.title: Government Launches 4 Billion Won Steel Export Guarantee for SMEs
item.description: The South Korean government has introduced a 4 billion won steel export guarantee program to support small and medium-sized steel companies facing global oversupply and export barriers. The initiative aims to strengthen the industry's resilience and encourage high value-added and low-carbon transitions.

item.title: South Korea to Restructure Steel Industry Hit by Tariffs, Oversupply
item.description: South Korea plans to restructure its steel industry in response to higher tariffs from the US and EU and ongoing oversupply issues. The government will adjust production capacity for oversupplied products and expand financial and policy support for exporters.

item.title: China Aims to Revive Steelmaking Without Ordering Cuts to Supply
item.description: China is adopting a measured approach to reviving its steel industry, focusing on improving the outlook for high-end companies without mandating supply cuts. The strategy emphasizes market-driven adjustments and selective demand growth.

item.title: Gov't Unveils Steps to Support Restructuring of Steel Industry to Overcome Supply Glut
item.description: The South Korean government has announced measures to support the restructuring of the steel industry to address the supply glut. The steps include capacity adjustments and expanded support for exporters facing international trade barriers.

item.title: German Social Democrats Push for Full EU Ban on Russian Steel Imports
item.description: Germany's ruling Social Democrats are urging the EU to impose a full ban on Russian steel imports, arguing that continued imports undermine sanctions and threaten Europe's industrial base. The move is part of broader measures to safeguard European steel production and employment.

item.title: Australian Steel Supply to Protect Sovereignty of Hunter Class Frigate Program
item.description: Australia is securing domestic steel supply for the Hunter Class Frigate Program to ensure national sovereignty. The initiative highlights the importance of local steel production for strategic defense projects.

item.title: Australian steel supply to protect sovereignty of Hunter Class Frigate Program
item.description: Australia's largest steelworks is supplying steel to support the Hunter Class Frigate Program, emphasizing domestic steel production's role in national sovereignty and security. This initiative highlights the strategic importance of sustainable and reliable steel supply chains for critical defense infrastructure.

item.title: Macquarie tips 23% upside for resurgent ASX 200 copper stock riding the red metals bull run
item.description: Capstone Copper shares have surged 32.5% year-to-date, outperforming the ASX 200 index, supported by operational successes and rising copper prices currently around US$10,855 per tonne. The copper price is up 23.8% year-to-date, fueling optimism for further gains in copper stocks.

item.title: Macquarie tips 23% upside for resurgent ASX 200 copper stock riding the red metals bull run
item.description: Capstone Copper reported a 16.5% year-on-year increase in copper production to 55,280 tonnes in Q3 2025, with a 6% rise in average realized copper price to US$4.49 per pound. The company achieved record adjusted EBITDA of US$249.2 million, up 106% year on year, driven by increased sulphide copper production and lower costs, with C1 cash costs down 15% from Q3 2024. Management reconfirmed full-year 2025 production and cost guidance.

item.title: ASX Copper Stock Capstone Shows Strong 23% Upside Potential
item.description: Capstone Copper's Q3 2025 results showed a 16.5% increase in copper production to 55,280 tonnes, a 6% improvement in average realized price to US$4.49 per pound, and a 15% reduction in C1 cash costs to $2.42 per pound. The company’s operational improvements and increased sulphide copper production contributed to record earnings, despite geopolitical and environmental challenges affecting global copper supply.

item.title: Teck Highlights Progress on Quebrada Blanca Ramp up, Pathway to Full Potential, and Value Delivery to Shareholders from Merger
item.description: Teck reported that mill throughput and recoveries at Quebrada Blanca are on track, with ongoing construction and technology upgrades progressing as planned. The proposed merger with Anglo American aims to create a top five global copper producer with combined production of 1.2 million tonnes, expected to grow to approximately 1.35 million tonnes by 2027, supported by operational synergies and growth opportunities.

item.title: Hot Stocks: True North Copper, Trigg Minerals, 29Metals
item.description: 29Metals reported new high-grade copper intercepts from its 2025 drilling campaign at the Golden Grove mine, indicating potential for mine life extension and improved mining economics. Trigg Minerals identified a large antimony-bearing hydrothermal system in Utah, defining several high-priority drill targets. These developments highlight ongoing exploration and resource expansion efforts in copper and associated minerals.

item.title: Glencore said to consider shutting Canada's largest copper plant
item.description: Glencore is reportedly planning to wind down its Horne Smelter, Canada's largest copper-metal producing plant, due to the need for steep environmental upgrades. This potential closure could impact copper production capacity in Canada and reflects increasing regulatory pressures on mining operations.

item.title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
item.description: Nickel prices fell 1.8% to $15,235 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, reaching a four-year low due to a gloomy outlook from the Federal Reserve and concerns over higher financing costs. Despite Indonesia considering deep cuts to nickel mining quotas to support prices, the market remains pressured by a wave of new supply and slowing electric-vehicle sales.

item.title: Indonesia's nickel smelters struggle amid oversupply, weak prices
item.description: The Indonesian Nickel Industry Forum (FINI) warns that domestic nickel smelter operators are facing difficulties due to oversupply and weak nickel prices. This reflects broader market challenges as Indonesia is a dominant nickel producer grappling with price pressures.

item.title: On November 4, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
item.description: The SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged between 120,300 and 123,300 yuan/mt with an average price of 121,800 yuan/mt, down 200 yuan/mt from the previous day, indicating a slight decline in refined nickel prices in China.

item.title: Nickel Hits 4-week Low
item.description: Nickel prices decreased to 15,151 USD/T, the lowest since September 2025, reflecting a 0.43% loss over the past four weeks and a 15.33% decline over the last 12 months, highlighting ongoing downward pressure on nickel prices.

item.title: Pacific Nickel to sell Solomon Islands assets, exit Kolosori nickel project
item.description: Pacific Nickel Mines agreed to sell its Solomon Islands subsidiaries, including the Kolosori nickel project, signaling a strategic exit from these assets amid challenging market conditions for nickel.

item.title: Indonesia's nickel smelters struggle amid oversupply, weak prices
item.description: The Indonesian Nickel Industry Forum (FINI) has warned that domestic nickel smelter operators are facing increasing difficulties due to oversupply and weak nickel prices. This situation is linked to Indonesia's booming nickel intermediate production, which has flooded global markets and pressured prices downward.

item.title: Nickel futures fall to over 1-month low amid oversupply from Indonesia
item.description: Nickel futures dropped below $15,100 per tonne, marking the lowest price in over a month, driven by oversupply from Indonesia. Indonesian nickel production has surged, pushing LME inventories to record highs, with a significant share of Chinese-origin nickel in stocks. In response, Indonesia has tightened production quotas and mining permit regulations to stabilize prices.

item.title: Pacific Nickel to sell Solomon Islands assets, exit Kolosori nickel project
item.description: Base metals company Pacific Nickel Mines has agreed to sell its subsidiaries in the Solomon Islands, including the Kolosori nickel project, signaling an exit from this nickel production asset. This move reflects strategic adjustments in the company's portfolio amid changing market conditions.

item.title: Group urges stronger oversight of PH nickel mining impact
item.description: An advocacy group has called for stronger government oversight of nickel mining in the Philippines, highlighting environmental and social impacts such as deforestation, water contamination, and increased climate vulnerability. The group demands that nickel companies address pollution and properly manage mine waste to mitigate harm to local communities.

item.title: The future of EU steel research – How to foster EU steel leadership
item.description: An upcoming event will focus on groundbreaking steel technologies, sustainability strategies, and challenges facing the EU steel industry. Topics include low to zero emission steel production and circularity, aiming to disseminate steel R&D projects and foster EU leadership in sustainable steel innovation.
